skill.name: snowtower-user
skill.description: Helps end-users get Snowflake access and use the platform. Use when users ask about requesting access, generating RSA keys, connecting to Snowflake, or basic Snowflake usage. Triggers on mentions of access requests, RSA keys, connection issues, or "how do I get access".

skill.author: Database-Tycoon

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for Snowflake access. No executable code, no file access, no network operations. Contains standard RSA key generation instructions and SQL examples for legitimate database operations.

content.value_statement: New team members need clear instructions to request Snowflake access. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for generating RSA keys, submitting access requests, and connecting to Snowflake via CLI, Python, or web interface.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through RSA key pair generation for Snowflake authentication
Explain the access request process via GitHub issues
Provide connection instructions for Snow CLI, Python, and web UI
Show first session SQL queries to verify access
Troubleshoot common authentication and permission errors
Describe default role, warehouse, and personal database setup
limitations: Cannot approve or process access requests - only guides users through submission
Cannot execute Snowflake queries - provides examples for users to run
Cannot configure VPN or network access requirements
Does not replace official Snowflake documentation for advanced operations

output_examples.input: How do I get started with Snowflake?
output: Step 1: Generate RSA keys on your machine (run these commands in terminal)
Step 2: Submit access request via GitHub issue with your public key
Step 3: Wait for approval (3-5 business days)
Step 4: Connect using Snow CLI, Python, or web UI
Your default role grants read access to shared production data and a personal database for development.

best_practices: Always use RSA key authentication for CLI and programmatic access instead of passwords
Set correct file permissions on private keys (chmod 400) to prevent unauthorized access
Never share your private key - only the public key is safe to share in access requests
anti_patterns: Using password authentication for scripts and applications instead of RSA keys
Storing private keys in shared directories or committing them to version control
Skipping the access request process and asking colleagues to share their credentials

faq.question: How long does access approval take?
faq.answer: Typical approval time is 3-5 business days. You'll receive your username, account identifier, default role, and warehouse after approval.

faq.question: Can I use password authentication instead of RSA keys?
faq.answer: Passwords are only for the Snowflake web UI. Use RSA keys for CLI, Python, and any programmatic access for better security.

faq.question: What permissions do I get by default?
faq.answer: New users receive a role with read access to shared production data, access to common warehouses, and a personal database for development.

faq.question: How do I request access to additional databases?
faq.answer: Open a new GitHub issue specifying what you need access to and include business justification. An admin will review your request.

faq.question: Is my data safe in my personal database?
faq.answer: Your personal database (DEV_YOURNAME) is isolated. You have full control to create schemas and tables for your analysis.

faq.question: How does this compare to SnowDDL?
faq.answer: This skill is for end-users getting access. SnowDDL is for administrators managing infrastructure as code. Use the admin skill for role and permission management.
